features: BBC Sport: News and match results

documents.text:
Article: 2025 Africa Cup of Nations (EN)
Date: 2026-01-02
Source: Wikipedia-EN
CatÃ©gorie: tournament_info

Contenu:
ðŸ“‹ INFORMATIONS TOURNOI:
â€¢ Dates: 21 December 2025 â€“ 18 January 2026
â€¢ Host country: Morocco
â€¢ Teams: 24
â€¢ Venue: 9Â (in 6 host cities)
â€¢ MatchesÂ played: 36
â€¢ Goals scored: 87Â (2.42 per match)
â€¢ Attendance: 729,935Â (20,276 per match)
â€¢ Top scorer(s): Riyad Mahrez Ayoub El Kaabi Brahim DÃ­az (3 goals each)

The2025 Africa Cup of Nations, known in short as the2025 AFCONorCAN 2025and forsponsorship purposesas theTotalEnergies2025 Africa Cup of Nations, is the 35th edition of the biennialAfrica Cup of Nationstournament organised by theConfederation of African Football(CAF).It is the second edition hosted by Morocco after1988.Morocco was originally scheduled to hostthe 2015 edition, but withdrew due to fears stemming from theWestern African Ebola virus epidemic.

Due toFIFAexpanding itsClub World Cupcompetition to 32 teams and having itscheduled for June and July 2025, this edition of the tournament is played between 21 December 2025 and 18 January 2026.It is the first time that the tournament is played over the Christmas and New Year period. The situation has been further complicated by the addition of two extra match days scheduled for the last two weeks of January in the expanded2025â€“26 UEFA Champions Leagueseason.

This edition of the tournament was scheduled to be the second after2019to take place during the northern hemisphere's summer (Juneâ€“July), in order to reduce scheduling conflicts with European club teams and competitions;the previous2023 editionwas moved to January and February 2024 owing to the adverse summer weather conditions in Ivory Coast.Guineawas originally set as hosts for this edition of the tournament, but had its hosting rights stripped after affirming its inadequacy of hosting preparations.After a second bidding process,Morocco was named as the new hosts on 27 September 2023.Ivory Coastarethe defending champions.

CAF stripped Cameroon from hostingthe 2019 editionof the tournament on 30 November 2018 due to lack of speed of progress in preparations,but accepted former CAF presidentAhmad Ahmad's request to stagethe next edition in 2021. Consequently, the original hosts of 2021, Ivory Coast, became hosts ofthe 2023 editionwith Guinea instead hosting the 2025 edition, which until then had no hosts.The CAF President confirmed the timetable shift after a meeting with Ivorian presidentAlassane OuattarainAbidjan, Ivory Coast on 30 January 2019.On 30 September 2022, current CAF president Patrice Motsepe announced thatGuineahad been stripped as host for the 2025 edition due to inadequacy and speed of progress in hosting preparations.Consequently, a new process was re-opened for a replacement host bidder.On 27 September 2023, the 2025 edition was awarded toMoroccoand the 2027 edition toKenya,Tanzania, andUganda.

The tournament mascot, named Assad (Arabic:Ø£Ø³Ø¯), was revealed on 8 December 2025. It is aBarbary lion, a reference to Morocco's national animal and nickname of thenational team of Morocco.

On 10 November 2025, CAF andPumaunveiled "Itri" (Standard Moroccan Amazigh:âµ‰âµœâµ”âµ‰,lit.'star') as the official tournament edition match ball. The ball, covered inzellijart in red and green, is influenced by an ancient mosaic tradition known for its complex geometric decoration and reflects the shared spirit and enthusiasm of football across Africa. Produced by Puma using Orbital 6 technology, the design combines star-based forms, floral motifs and circular patterns, conveying joy and the coming together of the 24 nations taking part in the tournament.

The official song is "Africallez" which stands as one of the tournament's emblems,fusing sporting fervor, cultural identity, and a message of continental unity. Conceived as a true Pan-African anthem, "Africallez" is performed by three artists whose styles complement each other perfectly: Beninese divaAngÃ©lique Kidjo, a global icon of African music; French-Moroccan singerLartiste, a key figure in the urban and international music scenes; and Moroccan artist Jaylane, who symbolizes the country's new artistic generation.

The winners will receive US$10 million, an increase from US$7 million for the 2023 event.

Official Title Sponsor | Official Global Partners | Official Competition Sponsors | Official Suppliers

LaCoupe d'Afrique des nations de football2025est la35eÃ©dition du tournoi biennal de football des associations africaines organisÃ© par laConfÃ©dÃ©ration africaine de football(CAF). Le tournoi est organisÃ© auMarocpour la deuxiÃ¨me fois, aprÃ¨s lâ€™Ã©dition de1988. La compÃ©tition se dÃ©roule du 21 dÃ©cembre 2025 au 18 janvier 2026.

L'Ã©dition prÃ©cÃ©dente de 2023a Ã©tÃ© dÃ©calÃ©e aux mois dejanvieretfÃ©vrier 2024, en raison des conditions mÃ©tÃ©orologiques estivales dÃ©favorables enCÃ´te d'Ivoire. LaGuinÃ©edevait Ãªtre l'hÃ´te initial du tournoi, mais ses droits d'accueil lui ont Ã©tÃ© retirÃ©s aprÃ¨s avoir affirmÃ© son insuffisance dans les prÃ©paratifs d'accueil. AprÃ¨s une deuxiÃ¨me procÃ©dure de candidature, le Maroc a Ã©tÃ© dÃ©signÃ© comme pays hÃ´te le27 septembre 2023. Le tenant du titre est laCÃ´te d'Ivoire, vainqueur de la derniÃ¨re Ã©dition.

LaConfÃ©dÃ©ration africaine de footballa retirÃ© auCamerounl'organisation de l'Ã©dition 2019le30 novembre 2018en raison du manque de rapiditÃ© des prÃ©paratifs, mais a acceptÃ© la demande de l'ancien prÃ©sident de la CAF,Ahmad Ahmad, d'organiser laprochaine Ã©dition en 2021.
